dockerfileLines: RUN apk update && apk add openssh rsync nano openssl bash

variables.label: Remote source location
variables.description: The remote directory from which the content will be downloaded

variables.label: The base64 encoded version of private key for establish the SSH connection.
variables.description: To convert your private to base64, run `cat private.key | openssl base64 | tr -d '\n'`

variables.label: The remote SSH address.
variables.description: Either an IP or a host such as captain.domain.com - DO NOT add HTTP(S)

variables.label: The remote SSH User
variables.description: Usually root, unless you set up another user

instructions.start: This app sets up a simple linux container with "rsync". The rsync process checks to see if there is any new files to be downloaded, and it downloads them immediately. ** IMPORTANT: ** Make sure `rsync` is installed on the remote machine. If you're SSHing into a container, make sure `rsync` is installed in the container.
instructions.end: The container is built and deployed. You can view the logs by going to Apps > $$cap_appname > deployment tab

description: Just a simple container that has runs rsync to download content periodically
